thread.title: Stars get 'Conscious' at exclusive H&M dinner
thread.title_full: Stars get 'Conscious' at exclusive H&M dinner

title: Stars get 'Conscious' at exclusive H&M dinner
text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Stars get 'Conscious' at exclusive H&M dinner The stars aligned Tuesday for the H&M Conscious Exclusive Dinner at Los Angeles' Smogshoppe. Entertainers like Chrissy Teigen and Orlando Bloom hit the scene, dressed to impress in support of Conscious Exclusive, H&M’s sustainable collection. Want to revisit the evening at one of L&A’s greenest venues? Just click through our gallery. Entertainers like Chrissy Teigen and Orlando Bloom hit the scene, dressed to impress in support of Conscious Exclusive, H&M’s sustainable collection. Want to revisit the evening at one of L&A’s greenest venues? Just click through our gallery. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Stars get 'Conscious' at exclusive H&M dinner None The stars aligned Tuesday for the H&M Conscious Exclusive Dinner at Los Angeles' Smogshoppe. Entertainers like Chrissy Teigen and Orlando Bloom hit the scene, dressed to impress in support of Conscious Exclusive, H&M’s sustainable collection. Want to revisit the evening at one of L&A’s greenest venues? Just click through our gallery. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None Model Natalia Vodianova, the face of the eco-conscious collection, and H&M's Ann-Sofie Johansson, right, emceed the dinner, posing for a photo op before putting on their hostess hats. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None Hailey Baldwin was among the many A-list guests, offering her take on casual chic in a bomber jacket and cropped pants. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None Our favorite ‘Girl’ Rowan Blanchard played up her casual distressed jeans look with a silk blouse with statement sleeves and a dramatic topper. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None On the other side of the fashion spectrum, ‘American Honey’ star Sasha Lane arrived in a sweeping gown with a sheer, plunging neckline. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None And Orlando’s fashion appeared to be in full Bloom as he stepped out in a smart, black suit. (Unfortunately, his shoes didn’t get the memo about the formal look.) Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None Meanwhile, model Shaun Ross kept it all the way relaxed. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None Perhaps they could take a cue from actress Kiersey Clemons, who looked ‘Dope' rocking her natural coils and a crisp, on-trend pantsuit. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None Writer, actress, and producer Erin Foster took a page out of a similar style playbook, donning a polka-dotted blouse with cropped black pants and stilettos. And, of course, we can’t forget about the statement purse. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None Oh, this? This is nothing. Just Pyper America Smith, left, Lucky Blue Smith and Daisy Clementine Smith serving face... Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None ...while YouTube personality Amanda Steele serves sunshine. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None But she wasn’t the only one bringing color to the event. Just check out model Angela Lindvall’s dress. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M None And then there's actress Ahna O'Reilly, who didn't need any 'Help' sparkling. Charley Gallay, Getty Images for H&M Like this topic?
